subject: Programming
title: The Dunning-Kruger Effect
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Dunning-Kruger Effect.

hook.text: Beginners often overestimate their skill. Experts often underestimate theirs. Confidence lies.

buildup.text: The Dunning-Kruger effect shows that the less you know, the harder it is to see what you don't know.

discovery.text: Junior developers feel confident because they haven't yet encountered the problems that humble experts.

twist.text: After the initial peak of false confidence comes the valley of despair â€” realizing how much more there is.

climax.text: True expertise includes knowing the limits of your knowledge. Humility is a sign of growth.

punchline.text: The more you learn, the more you realize you don't know.

quiz.question: What does the Dunning-Kruger effect describe?
options: Beginners overestimate and experts underestimate their skills
Only experts can judge code quality
